oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Schoolgirl set entertained at tea, from the Nashville Times, 1940
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: A captioned photo from the Nashville Times (1940), about a young student’s tea party. The caption reads: “An attractive school girl tea was given recently by Miss Carolyn Montgomery at the home of her parents, Mr. and Mrs. C. A. Montgomery, on Essex Place. Seen with the hostess is the following group that assisted in serving, and in giving a musical program: Gertrude Lasseter, Barbara Farrell, Caroline Stringe, Joan Smith, Carolyn Montgomery, Barbara Porter, Ruth Wilson, Caroline Acree? Benz, and Joy Greene. According to the 1941 City Directory, Mr. Clyde A. (wife Belle) was the office manager at C. W. Kempkau & Company, residence Essex Place. Forms part of the Nashville Times newspaper collection. 1 digital photo.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Montgomery, Clyde A.
